pullRequest.body:
This adds a new folder `NumberTheory/JacobiSum` and a first file `Basic.lean` in it, which defines the *Jacobi sum* of two multiplicative characters (on a finite commutative ring with values in another commutative ring) and provides some first results.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

`+ jacobiSum_eq_sum_sdiff`

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10596290309/job/29363934175)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10596290309/job/29363934758)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Maybe put the more complicated term on the LHS of the inequality?
Good point. The proof doesn't even need to change...
Actually, it even gets simpler!
I thought that the fashion now was `[Finite R]`?
I think I tried that, and then `Finset.sum` complained...
I think it is because `Finset.univ` requires a `Fintype` instance.
`attribute [local instance] Fintype.ofFinite` fixes this (or `letI := Fintype.ofFinite F` in lots of places)

My understanding is that when it is needed for a statement or definition, requiring `Fintype` should be OK, and if it is just needed in a proof, requiring `Finite` is preferred (and then using `Fintype.ofFinite` in the proof); by analogy with `Decidable`. If desired, one can always use `Fintype.ofFinite` in either way when using the results.

Note that using `Finite` instead of `Fintype`  makes `jacobiSum` noncomputable and does not allow proofs like
```lean
example : jacobiSum ZMod.χ₄ ZMod.χ₄ = 0 := rfl
```
or
```lean
example : jacobiSum ZMod.χ₄ ZMod.χ₄ = 0 := by decide
```

So I think keeping `Fintype` is better here.
You could just `lemma Finset.sum_eq_sum_one_sub` I guess
OK.
(Still keeping it `private`, though.)

Maybe
```suggestion
  _ = ∑ _ ∈ (univ \ {0, 1} : Finset F), (1 : R) := sum_congr rfl this
```
? Gets rid of the @ at the expense of more characters...

I think so. And I guess you can use `#find_home` to find a better place for it. And maybe generalize `1` to an arbitrary element `r` of `R`?
It could also be a `simp`-lemma, I think.

And if you like it, the version with `x + r` should be just as short, and can maybe be added for completeness?
Further inspection shows that this is (up to DefEq / `Equiv.subLeft_apply`) just `(Equiv.subLeft 1).sum_comp f`, so I'm now opting for inlining it.

```suggestion
  simp only [jacobiSum, mul_comm (χ _)]
  rw [← sum_one_sub_eq_sum]
  simp only [sub_sub_cancel]
```

```suggestion
theorem jacobiSum_one_one : jacobiSum (1 : MulChar F R) 1 = Fintype.card F - 2 := by
```
would it make sense to also have the version that syntactically mentions `MulChar.trivial`?
OK; added the version using `MulChar.trivial` as well.

```suggestion
    rw [← map_mul, MulChar.trivial_apply, if_pos]
    simp only [mem_sdiff, mem_univ, mem_insert, mem_singleton, not_or, ← ne_eq, true_and] at hx
    simpa only [isUnit_iff_ne_zero, mul_ne_zero_iff, ne_eq, sub_eq_zero, @eq_comm _ _ x] using hx
```

Maybe a bit hacky to abuse `lt/le` like this:
```suggestion
    obtain ⟨m, hm⟩ : ∃ m : ℕ, Fintype.card F = m + 2 :=
      Nat.exists_eq_add_of_le' Fintype.one_lt_card
    rw [hm, add_tsub_cancel_right]
    simp only [Nat.cast_add, Nat.cast_ofNat, add_sub_cancel_right]
```
I guess we should just have `Fintype.two_le_card`.
Golfed this a bit further using `Nat.cast_sub <| Nat.add_one_le_of_lt Fintype.one_lt_card` (avoiding the hack via `Nat.add_one_le_of_lt`).

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(NumberTheory/JacobiSum/Basic): add file (def., basic API)
